result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J Romano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $600.00 plus surcharges.
Spend 1yr in the county jail - all but 30 days is stayed.  Perform 250 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not have contact with known felons or drug dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  May not obtain employment until sufficient level of sobriety is recorded and agent allows.  No work where Deft drives children.

timeConds.notes: All but 30 days jail is STAYED.

for Restitution Order ($600.00)  kmk
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney E Olson. Clerk/H. Barnett. Victim B.B.H. appeared and gave statement. Statement from Patrick R. Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions, concurrent on cts 1 & 2 and with 17CF139; 1 year conditional jail, all but 30 days is stayed; deft to pay $500 DNA surcharge; restitution ordered in the amount of $600 (by stipulation of deft); bond applied to restitution/costs, any remainder applied to restitution/costs in file 17CF139. No contact with known felons or drug dealers. May not obtain employment until sufficient level of sobriety is recorded and agent allows. No work where deft drives children.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney E Olson. Clerk/H. Barnett. Deft waives right to motion pending. On State's motion, ct 3 is dismissed and read in. Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2. Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2. PSI ordered. DNA sample ordered. SEH 9/25/17 at 2:30pm. Bond continued.

State appeared by Special Prosecutor Thaddeus McGuire.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney E Olson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Olson states he needs to discuss case w/ADA Phan.  JS remains set for 8/14/17 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney E Olson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  Atty Olson states he obtained the file on Monday, needs time to review file and meet w/deft.  STC continued to 6/15/17 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
Joseph Eric Olson
to withdraw as counsel; filed by Atty L Breckenfelder.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Breckenfelder.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Breckenfelder's motion to withdraw; states she believes the case was going to resolve with a plea.  Court grants motion.  STC set for 5/25/17 at 10am.  Bond continued.

ADA Phan requests a trial date be scheduled and then the parties can continue to negotiate.  Atty Breckenfelder states she believes the deft may be a good candidate for the drug court.  STC set for 5/5/17 at 9:30am and JS on 8/14/17 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Lauren Breckenfelder.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Attorney Breckenfelder indicates that the DE is still in the vivitrol program and needs additional time to complete treatment.  Attorney Phan and Attorney Breckenfelder will discuss restitution as part of the offer made.  FPT set for 3/23/17 @ 8:15.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty DeFilippis states the deft is starting the Vivitrol program.  FPT continued to 11/14/16 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Parties report the deft is presently in the "education" phase of treatment; he is on track to continue with treatment.  FPT set for 9/16/16 @ 8:45am.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R. DeFilippis.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  DDA Gravely reports the deft is getting into programming.  FPT continued to 7/15/16 @ 8:30.  Bond continued.

DDA Graveley states he has been provided documentation of treatment deft is receiving; would like time to consider how it will affect his offer.  FPT continued to 5/27/16 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 4/8/16 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
